entry.title: An implementation of BIP102 as a softfork.
entry.summary: In an email sent on December 30, 2015, Peter Todd attempted to alleviate fears surrounding the use of recursion in generalized softforks. He argued that with proper planning, it is easy to avoid recursion. The recipient of the email downgraded their emotions from terror to discomfort upon receiving this information. No further context or information was provided in the email chain.
